definition:
Suppose $\Omega$ is an open set in ${\mathbb{R}}^3$, and ${\mathbf{V}}$
is a vector field with differentiable real (or possibly complex) valued
component functions. If $\nabla\times {\mathbf{V}}=0$, then
${\mathbf{V}}$ is called an [**irrotional vector field**]{}, or [**curl
free field**]{}.

If ${\mathbf{U}}$ and ${\mathbf{V}}$ are irrotational, then
${\mathbf{U}}\times{\mathbf{V}}$ is solenoidal.
